Exception: java.lang.AbstractMethodError

Message: Compile error, caught Throwable: java.lang.AbstractMethodError
Stack trace: java.lang.AbstractMethodError	at 
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.getFormattedOption
sString(AspectJBuildManager.java:185)	
at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run
(AspectJBuildManager.java:161)

This error probably indicates that you have two versions of AspectJ JARs on 
your classpath.  Could you please provide more details on how you're compiling 
(within AJBrowser?) and what's on your classpath?  Also, you can go into the 
preferences in the AJBrowser to find the classpath being used: Tools -> 
Options -> AJBrowser Options -> Classpath.

Without more information I assume that this was the result of multiple AspectJ
JARs eing on the classpath.
